<title level="1" pfs="Standard">[Raven Swarm](/Monsters.aspx?ID=782)</title>

<row gap="medium">

<column gap="medium" flex="1 1 400px">

A flock of ravens is known as an unkindness. Certainly the name lives up to its meaning when a swarm of ravens decides to work together. In most cases, a raven swarm like the one presented here won't attack larger foes, but when manipulated by supernatural forces or simple desperation born from hunger, an unkindness of ravens can be a surprisingly dangerous foe.

<column gap="tiny">
**[Recall Knowledge - Animal](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)**
([Nature](/Skills.aspx?ID=10)): DC 18

**[Unspecific Lore](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)**: DC 16

**[Specific Lore](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)**: DC 13
</column>

</column>

<column gap="medium">

</column>

</row>

<title level="2" right="Creature 3">[Raven Swarm](/Monsters.aspx?ID=782)</title>

<traits>
<trait label="N" url="/Rules.aspx?ID=95" />
<trait label="Large" />
<trait label="Animal" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=9" />
<trait label="Swarm" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=239" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

<row gap="tiny">**Source** [Bestiary 2](/Sources.aspx?ID=32) pg. 221 <sup>2.0</sup></row>

**Perception** +9; [low-light vision](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=23)

**Languages**

**Skills**
[Acrobatics](/Skills.aspx?ID=1) +10, [Thievery](/Skills.aspx?ID=17) +10

<row gap="medium">
**Str** +0

**Dex** +3

**Con** +0

**Int** -4

**Wis** +4

**Cha** +0
</row>

</column>

---

<column gap="tiny">

<row gap="medium">
**AC** 19 

**Fort** +7 

**Ref** +12 

**Will** +9 

</row>

**HP** 30

**Immunities**
precision, [swarm mind](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=36)

**Resistances**
bludgeoning 2, piercing 5, slashing 5

**Weaknesses**
area damage 5, [splash](/Traits.aspx?ID=150) damage 5

</column>

---

<column gap="tiny">

**Speed** 10 feet, fly 40 feet

**Enraged Cunning**   There are few things as dangerously persistent in the natural world as an angry unkindness of ravens. A raven swarm can hound its prey through most barriers. Simple latches, unsecured chimney flues, loosely shuttered windows, and similar obstacles rarely keep an unkindness away. A raven swarm attempts a [Thievery](/Skills.aspx?ID=17) check to bypass many of these simple obstructions, typically against DC 20.

**Swarming Beaks** <actions string="Single Action" />  The ravens' angry pecking deals 1d8 piercing damage to each enemy in the swarm's space (DC 20 basic Reflex save). A creature that critically fails its save is [blinded](/Conditions.aspx?ID=1) for 1d4 rounds as the ravens focus their attacks on the target's vulnerable face.

</column>
